qas.question: What does the abbreviation OCA stand for?
What is the function or definition of the OCA according to JP 1-02?

answers.text: offensive operations to destroy, disrupt, or neutralize enemy aircraft, missiles, launch platforms

qas.question: OCA is the preferred method of defeating what kind of attacks?
What is one of the important functions of the OCA in dealing with attacks?

context: <a0_0>Offensive Counterair<a0_0/> (OCA) is defined as "<a1_0>offensive operations to destroy, disrupt, or neutralize enemy aircraft, missiles, launch platforms<a1_0/>, and their supporting structures and systems both before and after launch, but as close to their source as possible" (JP 1-02). OCA is the preferred method of countering <a2_0>air and missile threats<a2_0/>, since it attempts to defeat the enemy closer to its source and typically enjoys the initiative. OCA comprises attack operations, sweep, escort, and <a3_0>suppression/destruction of enemy air defense<a3_0/>.
